channel.title: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD

item.title: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Tutorial:

Funny thing is that a big percentage of children that are born is due to underage pregnancy.

What we call underage now, was normal back a couple hundred years ago. The only reason we call it underage now is because thats what we are told all our lives. Its Parents telling us this so that we, as their children (even though Im 21), don’t have kids before we are out of school. Most of the time, if you have a child while your in High School or earlier then you will endup dropping out to get a job to be able to pay for said child to have diapers and things.

Read full topic

item.title: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:28, topic:509375”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=627622.msg4266195#msg4266195 date=1364077336]

you should also add deaths (disease, war, etc etc)

I introduced HIV into the system in a very poor manor, no honesty or common courtesy for people with HIV, they just went about their normal day lol. Turns out the rate at which people ‘breed’ was much slower than I thought, and when you start with 6000 people, even though over 5k of them ended up with HIV (placed a < instead of >), it quickly died down to only 4-5 infections per year. Also made it (even though idk if its true) so that babies whos parents both had HIV would be born with it.
Really didn’t take long for it to dwindle down to 1-2 infections at most per year (the number included babies born with it). To add a real population simulator would require a rather large amount of code, probably 10k-15k lines just to get everything in their correctly, because with War, you need countries, obviously a person in America cant breed with someone who is currently in China, all in all it would probably slow the process down alot. Would need a job for everyone (maybe?) for the recourse production and such. Just to much time to spend on a silly project IMO.
[/quote]
Hence why I kept it simple xD The HIV system seems interesting O.O
Wars require groups which require opinions and then you could have these opinions clash with eachother which would result in a war…
Economic system for food, etc… Famine…
The growth rate is too fast/high for my liking xD[/quote]
Here is a little bit of the output. As you can see it still starts out with an amazingly high amount of HIV infected people, but they still don’t breed much for some reason. Nothing that I changed in the code to make that happen, just happens to be how your breeding system turned out to effect with people who have HIV.

Current people: 3563 current year: 2 Current HIV Pop: 2780
Births: 271 Deaths: 3 Infections: 6

item.title: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:27, topic:509375”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=627622.msg4265904#msg4265904 date=1364053718]
you should also add deaths (disease, war, etc etc)
[/quote]
I introduced HIV into the system in a very poor manor, no honesty or common courtesy for people with HIV, they just went about their normal day lol. Turns out the rate at which people ‘breed’ was much slower than I thought, and when you start with 6000 people, even though over 5k of them ended up with HIV (placed a < instead of >), it quickly died down to only 4-5 infections per year. Also made it (even though idk if its true) so that babies whos parents both had HIV would be born with it.
Really didn’t take long for it to dwindle down to 1-2 infections at most per year (the number included babies born with it). To add a real population simulator would require a rather large amount of code, probably 10k-15k lines just to get everything in their correctly, because with War, you need countries, obviously a person in America cant breed with someone who is currently in China, all in all it would probably slow the process down alot. Would need a job for everyone (maybe?) for the recourse production and such. Just to much time to spend on a silly project IMO.[/quote]
Hence why I kept it simple xD The HIV system seems interesting O.O
Wars require groups which require opinions and then you could have these opinions clash with eachother which would result in a war…
Economic system for food, etc… Famine…
The growth rate is too fast/high for my liking xD

Read full topic
item.source: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD

item.title: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

you should also add deaths (disease, war, etc etc)

I introduced HIV into the system in a very poor manor, no honesty or common courtesy for people with HIV, they just went about their normal day lol. Turns out the rate at which people ‘breed’ was much slower than I thought, and when you start with 6000 people, even though over 5k of them ended up with HIV (placed a < instead of >), it quickly died down to only 4-5 infections per year. Also made it (even though idk if its true) so that babies whos parents both had HIV would be born with it.
Really didn’t take long for it to dwindle down to 1-2 infections at most per year (the number included babies born with it). To add a real population simulator would require a rather large amount of code, probably 10k-15k lines just to get everything in their correctly, because with War, you need countries, obviously a person in America cant breed with someone who is currently in China, all in all it would probably slow the process down alot. Would need a job for everyone (maybe?) for the recourse production and such. Just to much time to spend on a silly project IMO.

Read full topic

item.title: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

Maybe I should add a random number of people dying everyday xD
cbf to add food resources, etc…
http://www.funtrivia.com/askft/Question90487.html
55m yearly with +/- 7 billion people
on scale that makes 55/7000
which is 1/128
so that’s how I’ll add it xD

Read full topic

item.title: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:20, topic:509375”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=627622.msg4265296#msg4265296 date=1363984115]
Cres: Food is the most important factor to take into account in population growth.
[/quote]
How would I do that? :o
Add a system that produces a set amount of food and provid that to the population?[/quote]
Problem would be your food productivity would need to increase as the population does, otherwise your population will reach a peak point and come to a sudden hault.

EDIT: I’m gonna let the posted code run for a few days and see how things turn out lol.

Read full topic

      public Human(int age, int dAge, int potKids, char family) {                setAge(age);                setDeathAge(dAge);                setPotentialKids(potKids);                setFamily(family);                setBirthDelay(false);        }

item.title: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“Cruel Truth, post:14, topic:509375”][quote author=Cres link=topic=627622.msg4265217#msg4265217 date=1363979328]

Why do you have family’s datatype as a char? Makes no sense.

Death can happen at ANY age. It’s a random number between 0 and the max age xD
EDIT: changing the child limit to 5 fixed the stabilizing issue.
[/quote]That’s the problem though death isn’t determined by a random number. I meant you could have SIDS or just plain out die from car accidents and etc.

You need to take food into account.

[quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=627622.msg4265230#msg4265230 date=1363980023]
People can also mate further up than 42… Should be 15-50 IMO

Also people can have a lot more than 5 kids if they wish
[/quote]I have heard of women in their 60’s still bearing (just in recent years at that ) so it is possible.[/quote]

I could add in many factors such as diseases, food, genetic disorders, suicide, terrorist attacks, genocides, alien invasions etc…
But that would quickly get off-track and beat the simplicity of it xD

Read full topic
item.source: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD

Why do you have family’s datatype as a char? Makes no sense.
[/quote]

Death can happen at ANY age. It’s a random number between 0 and the max age xD
EDIT: changing the child limit to 5 fixed the stabilizing issue.[/quote]That’s the problem though death isn’t determined by a random number. I meant you could have SIDS or just plain out die from car accidents and etc.

Bowser jr:

You need to take food into account.

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:11, topic:509375”]People can also mate further up than 42… Should be 15-50 IMO

Also people can have a lot more than 5 kids if they wish[/quote]I have heard of women in their 60’s still bearing (just in recent years at that ) so it is possible.

item.title: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:11, topic:509375”]People can also mate further up than 42… Should be 15-50 IMO

Also people can have a lot more than 5 kids if they wish[/quote]
Try it out and set the child limit to 7. You’ll see that it grows MUCH faster than it should xD
40 - 50 is when the menopauze starts to kick in. So I decided to keep it low. Also, if I’d set it to 50 the growth would be more exponential.
I’m +/- trying to make it how the world grows.

Read full topic

item.title: Was bored... turned out to be fun xD
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

eyeownyew:

Why do you have family’s datatype as a char? Makes no sense.

I could make it anything but it doesn’t matter. There’s other ways to do it but I don’t care either way.
That’s how I wanted to do it. xD

Death can happen at ANY age. It’s a random number between 0 and the max age xD
EDIT: changing the child limit to 5 fixed the stabilizing issue.

Read full topic
